column2: RHODE ISLAND DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column8: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 2. When there is a _______ at an intersection, you should come to a complete stop, yield to cross traffic/pedestrians, and then proceed when clear.
column8: a flashing yellow light

column2: 3. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column8: pedestrians

column2: 4. When entering a crowded freeway, to merge into traffic you should:
column4: use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to the same speed as freeway traffic.
column6: yield to vehicles already on the freeway.
column8: check your blind spots.

column2: 5. While driving you come upon a sign which says, “reduced speed 35 MPH”. You as a driver should know:
column4: that you have plenty of time to slow down before the speed zone.
column6: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at this sign.
column8: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at the next “speed limit” sign.
column10: that the sign is put there to harass “good” drivers.

column2: 6. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 7. When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
column4: make sure the lane you are about to enter is clear.
column8: signal your intentions ahead of time.

column2: 8. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column8: Roundabout ahead.

column2: 10. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: tailgate the driver in front of you.
column8: drive above the posted speed limit.

column2: 11. The shape and color of a route number sign indicate the type of roadway.
12. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 13. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 14. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column8: yellow

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column8: Slippery when wet

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column8: 4-way stop

column2: 18. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you cannot see without moving your head.
column8: you see in your side mirror.
column10: you see in your rearview mirror.

column2: 19. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column6: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column8: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column10: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.

column2: 20. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: signal your return to the left lane.
column6: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.
column8: sound your horn as you pass.
